body:
a := 2
b := 5
a ^= b // ok

t := true
f := !t
t = t != f //t ^= f //operator ^ not defined on bool
/*
programmers love this :  t ^= f 
instead of:                       t = t != f
is it possible in the next versions of Go to enable  t ^= f 
or why this is disabled?

http://play.golang.org/p/lSS9Rr5V82
*/
